teal.goshawk 0.1.0
  • Reference

Box Plot

tm_g_boxplot.Rd

This teal module renders the UI and calls the functions that create a box plot and accompanying summary table.

tm_g_boxplot(label, dataname, param_var, param_choices = param, param,
  yaxis_var = "AVAL", yaxis_var_choices = c("AVAL", "CHG"),
  xaxis_var = "AVISITCD", xaxis_var_choices = NULL,
  facet_var = "ARM", facet_var_choices = NULL,
  filter_vars = c("BASE2", "BASE"), filter_labs = c("Screening",
  "Baseline"), trt_group = "ARM", color_manual = NULL,
  shape_manual = NULL, hline = NULL, facet_ncol = NULL,
  rotate_xlab = FALSE, pre_output = NULL, post_output = NULL,
  armlabel = NULL, plot_height = c(600, 200, 2000),
  code_data_processing = NULL)

Arguments

label

menu item label of the module in the teal app.
dataname

analysis data passed to the data argument of teal init. E.g. ADaM structured laboratory data frame ALB.
param_var

name of variable containing biomarker codes e.g. PARAMCD.
param_choices

list of biomarkers of interest.
param

biomarker selected.
yaxis_var

name of variable containing biomarker results displayed on y-axis e.g. AVAL.
yaxis_var_choices

list of variables containing biomarker results choices.
xaxis_var

variable to categorize the x-axis.
xaxis_var_choices

variable choices with which to categorize x-axis.
facet_var

variable to facet the plots by.
facet_var_choices

variable choices with which to facet the plots.
filter_vars

Variables to be used for filtering the data. The default is BASE2 and BASE
filter_labs

Labels for the radio buttons for the filter_vars. The defaults are "Screening" for BASE2 and "Baseline" for BASE.
trt_group

name of variable representing treatment group e.g. ARM.
color_manual

vector of colors applied to treatment values.
shape_manual

vector of symbols applied to LOQ values.
hline

y-axis value to position a horizontal line. NULL = No line.
facet_ncol

numeric value indicating number of facets per row.
rotate_xlab

45 degree rotation of x-axis values.
pre_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.
post_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.
armlabel

label for the treatment symbols in the legend. If not specified then the label attribute for trt_group will be used. If there is no label attribute for trt_group, then the name of the parameter (in title case) will be used.
plot_height

numeric vectors to define the plot height.
code_data_processing

TODO

Value

an module object#'

Examples



# NOT RUN {
# Example using ADaM structure analysis dataset.
# ALB refers to biomarker data stored in expected laboratory structure.

library(dplyr)

ASL <- ADSL
ALB <- ADLB

x <- teal::init(
  data =  list(ASL = ASL, ALB = ALB),
  modules = root_modules(
      tm_g_boxplot(
        label = "Box Plot",
        dataname = "ALB",
        param_var = "PARAMCD",
        param = "CRP",
        param_choices = c("CRP", "IGA", "IGG", "IGM"),
        yaxis_var = "AVAL",
        yaxis_var_choices = c("AVAL", "BASE", "CHG"),
        rotate_xlab = FALSE,
        xaxis_var = "ARM",
        xaxis_var_choices = c("ARM", "AVISITCD", "STUDYID"),
        facet_var= "AVISITCD",
        facet_var_choices = c("ARM", "AVISITCD"),
        trt_group = "ARM"
      )
  )
)
shinyApp(x$ui, x$server)

# }
